title: MongoDB High Availability
subject: MongoDB
theory: HA ensures the system remains operational. Write Concern (`w: majority`) ensures data is safe on multiple nodes. Read Preference (`primaryPreferred`, `secondary`) controls where queries are sent.

interview_questions.question: What does w:1 mean?
interview_questions.answer: Acknowledgment requested from the primary only.

exam_notes: Arbiter nodes don't hold data, just vote.
summary: Configuring HA correctly balances performance against data safety guarantees.
